m_szDocTitle: LG Chem Win $4.6m Contract to Develop Li-Ion Batteries for Vehicles
m_szDocSumamry: LG Chem Win $4.6m Contract to Develop Li-Ion Batteries for Vehicles Published on August 24, 2004 at 1:37 AM LG Chem, Ltd. , the largest chemical company in Korea, announced today that it has been granted a USD 4.6 million contract by the United States Advanced Battery Consortium (USABC) to develop advanced Lithium-ion Polymer Battery cells for Hybrid Electric Vehicles (HEVs).
